user.title: Neovolt Solar Inverter
user.description:
Configure your Neovolt inverter Modbus TCP connection.

Make sure your Modbus gateway (e.g., EW11A) is:
- Connected to the same network as Home Assistant
- Configured in TCP Server mode
- Port 502 is open and accessible

data_description.host: IP address of your Modbus TCP gateway (e.g., 192.168.1.100)
data_description.device_name: Optional name to identify this device. Leave empty for auto-numbering (1, 2, 3...)
data_description.device_role: Host: full control (settings + commands). Follower: read-only sensors only

power.title: Power Limits
power.description:
Configure power limits for your inverter system.

For parallel/master-slave setups, set the maximum power values to the total combined capacity of all inverters.

data_description.max_charge_power: Maximum charging power in kW. For parallel systems, enter total capacity (e.g., 15 for three 5kW units)
data_description.max_discharge_power: Maximum discharging power in kW. For parallel systems, enter total capacity

polling.title: Polling & Recovery
polling.description:
Configure adaptive polling intervals and auto-recovery settings.

Polling automatically speeds up for changing values and slows down for stable values.

data_description.min_poll_interval: Fastest polling rate for active values (hard minimum: 10s)
data_description.max_poll_interval: Slowest polling rate for stable values
data_description.consecutive_failure_threshold: Trigger auto-recovery after this many consecutive poll failures
data_description.staleness_threshold: Trigger auto-recovery if data hasn't changed for this many minutes

error.cannot_connect:
Cannot connect to the inverter.

Error: {error}

Troubleshooting:
1. Verify the IP address is correct
2. Check that port 502 is accessible (firewall)
3. Ensure Modbus gateway is powered on
4. Verify gateway is in TCP Server mode
5. Test with: ping [IP] from Home Assistant terminal
error.unknown:
Unexpected error occurred: {error}

Please check Home Assistant logs for details.

abort.already_configured: This device is already configured. Check Devices & Services.
